result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

advising courts Atty withdrawl from case. requesting time to obtain counsel. Request to quash warrant. Filed by DE. arc     Per EFV on 4-6-2022: "Request denied. Def. will have to turn himself in at jail" JA will let DE know. arc

11:04 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DE: Craig Joseph Hurrle did not appear. Victim Witness. Set for PTC. Court reviews case. ADA Ballo requests warrant. Court issues warrant- Adjoining counties- body only. Adjourned 11:06 AM

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:12 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Angela Raye Olson, DF: Craig Joseph Hurrle appeared. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant obtained Atty Olson. Enters NG plea. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Waives Speedy Trial. Adjounred 01:13PM  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial be held 3/2/22 instead of 3/3/22.     Approved by EFV on 3-1-2022. JA will reset INIT to 3-2-2022 and send new notices. mw
Filed by Atty Angela Olson. mw
Initial appearance on March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.


-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sara H .  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo. Craig Joseph Hurrle pro se. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Does not qualify for PD services. Has a meeting with Atty Olson tomorrow. Court will set bond and continue initial appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for S.N.H. Filed by DA's Office. hml
